hero.headline: Anthropic, OpenAI, and Google Unite: MCP Donated to Linux Foundation's Agentic AI Foundation
hero.summary: Anthropic announced it is donating the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to the Linux Foundation's newly established Agentic AI Foundation (AAIF) on December 9, 2025. The foundation is co-founded by Anthropic, Block, and OpenAI with support from Google, Microsoft, AWS, Cloudflare, and Bloomberg, marking an unprecedented collaboration in the AI industry.
hero.whyItMatters: This is a watershed moment for AI interoperability. MCP, which powers context sharing across Claude Code, Gemini CLI, and countless developer tools, is now industry-neutral infrastructure. The AAIF's founding members represent virtually every major player in AI, signaling that agentic AI standards are too important to be controlled by any single company. For developers, this means MCP investments are now future-proof.

topStories.title: Andrej Karpathy's 2025 Year in Review: A Retrospective on AI's Pivotal Year
topStories.summary: Andrej Karpathy published his annual year-in-review reflecting on AI's transformative 2025. From agentic coding reaching mainstream adoption to the emergence of reasoning models, Karpathy provides insights into what made this year pivotal and what's next for the field.

topStories.title: Agent Skills Specification: Anthropic Standardizes How AI Agents Learn New Capabilities
topStories.summary: The Agent Skills specification provides a standardized format for defining, sharing, and installing capabilities for AI coding agents. This open specification enables interoperability between Claude Code, Gemini CLI, Codex, and third-party tools.

topStories.title: Claude Code Hits $1 Billion Annual Revenue in Just 6 Months
topStories.summary: Anthropic announced Claude Code reached $1 billion in annualized revenue in November 2025, just six months after its public launch in May. Combined with the Accenture partnership training 30,000 professionals on Claude, this cements Claude Code's dominance in enterprise AI coding.

topStories.title: Mistral OCR 3: State-of-the-Art Document Understanding for AI Agents
topStories.summary: Mistral released OCR 3, their latest document understanding model. The release is gaining traction on Hacker News as developers explore integrating advanced OCR into AI agent workflows for processing PDFs, images, and complex documents.

trendingRepos.name: anthropics/claude-code
trendingRepos.description: Claude Code continues its dominance with 510 stars gained today. Now features LSP integration for code intelligence, extended terminal support, and syntax highlighting controls.

trendingRepos.name: sgl-project/mini-sglang
trendingRepos.description: Lightweight LLM serving implementation from the SGLang team gaining 504 stars today. A minimal yet powerful entry point for developers exploring fast inference engines.

trendingRepos.name: exo-explore/exo
trendingRepos.description: Run your own AI cluster at home with everyday devices. Distributed inference across phones, laptops, and desktops without expensive GPUs. 448 stars gained today.

trendingRepos.name: google/adk-js
trendingRepos.description: Google's open-source Agent Development Kit for TypeScript. Build, evaluate, and deploy AI agents with flexibility and control. Gaining 52 stars as developers explore structured agent frameworks.

trendingSkills.name: Test-Driven Development
trendingSkills.description: Write the test first, watch it fail, write minimal code to pass. Ensures tests actually verify behavior and prevents regressions in AI-assisted development workflows.

trendingSkills.name: Vexor CLI
trendingSkills.description: Semantic file discovery via the vexor command for locating implementations in large repos. Find relevant code by describing what you're looking for instead of exact matches.

trendingSkills.name: D3 Visualization
trendingSkills.description: Create sophisticated, interactive data visualizations using D3.js. Generate dynamic charts, graphs, and custom visualizations with AI-powered code generation.

trendingSkills.name: Investigation Scaffolding
trendingSkills.description: Scaffolds a template for small investigations and empirical experimentation. Structures hypothesis-driven debugging and exploratory coding sessions.

newMcpServers.name: playwright-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Automate browsers and APIs directly from Claude, Cursor, and other MCP clients. Full Playwright capabilities for web testing, scraping, and browser automation through AI assistants.

newMcpServers.name: database-server
newMcpServers.description: Comprehensive database server supporting PostgreSQL, MySQL, and SQLite with natural language SQL query capabilities. Enables AI agents to interact with databases through both direct SQL and conversational queries.

newMcpServers.name: hummingbot-mcp
newMcpServers.description: Control and monitor Hummingbot trading bots through AI-powered commands. Manage trading strategies, view positions, and automate trading workflows from your AI assistant.

newMcpServers.name: maven-tools-mcp
newMcpServers.description: JVM dependency intelligence for any build tool using Maven Central Repository. Includes Context7 integration for upgrade documentation and guidance on Java/Kotlin dependencies.

notableHooks.name: Context Injection on Prompt Submit
notableHooks.description: Automatically adds current time, git branch, and relevant context when you submit prompts. The hook stdout gets injected as context before Claude processes your request.

notableHooks.name: Session Environment Persistence
notableHooks.description: Persists environment variables across sessions by writing to $CLAUDE_ENV_FILE. Set NODE_ENV, PATH additions, and project-specific variables that survive session restarts.

notableHooks.name: Auto-Format After Edit
notableHooks.description: Runs Prettier or your preferred formatter after Write|Edit operations. Ensures consistent code style without manual intervention using the $file variable for the affected path.

tuiTools.name: k9s
tuiTools.description: Kubernetes CLI to manage your clusters in style. Terminal UI with real-time resource monitoring, log streaming, and kubectl shortcuts. Essential for DevOps workflows.

tuiTools.name: gitui
tuiTools.description: Blazing fast terminal-ui for git written in Rust. Keyboard-driven staging, committing, and branch management with a clean, responsive interface.

tuiTools.name: lazydocker
tuiTools.description: The lazier way to manage everything Docker. View containers, images, volumes, and networks with keyboard navigation. From the makers of lazygit.

tuiTools.name: helix
tuiTools.description: A post-modern text editor written in Rust. Modal editing inspired by Vim and Kakoune with built-in LSP support and tree-sitter integration. No configuration needed.

Hook command sanitization to prevent injection attacks

notableQuotes.quote: By donating MCP to the Linux Foundation, we're ensuring that the protocol for AI agent context sharing remains open, neutral, and governed by the community rather than any single company.
notableQuotes.author: Anthropic

notableQuotes.quote: 2025 was the year AI coding went from 'impressive demos' to 'daily driver'. The shift from prompt engineering to context engineering is reshaping how we think about developer tools.
notableQuotes.author: Andrej Karpathy

notableQuotes.quote: Developers using byLLM completed tasks over three times faster and wrote 45% fewer lines of code. The framework has seen over 14,000 downloads in one month since going open source.
notableQuotes.author: TechXplore

prompt: Generated via /generate-news slash command. Claude fetches data from 9 sources in parallel (aggregated RSS feed, 7 web searches, GitHub trending via trotd, SkillsMP feed, Claude Code/Gemini CLI/Codex changelogs, Docker MCP catalog via mcp-find, YouTube trending API, Claude Code hooks docs, awesome-tuis list), deduplicates against the past 14 days of digests, then curates into structured JSON.
